intro: Cyanastrum bussei, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to eastern Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its velvety, dark green leaves and clusters of showy, violet-colored flowers. The plant typically grows as a compact shrub, reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. It thrives in humid, well-drained soil and requires indirect sunlight to flourish. Cyanastrum bussei is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
